question: [File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/state_key/mod.rs] [Function: raw()] [Test-only raw keys] Raw keys marked as test-only in comments—if raw keys are allowed in production transactions, can attackers inject arbitrary state keys bypassing validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/state_key/mod.rs] [Function: is_aptos_code()] [Address enumeration gap] Lines 225-227 check ONE, THREE, FOUR but not TWO—is address TWO used for system code, and if so, does this omission allow unauthorized code access? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/state_key/mod.rs] [Function: is_aptos_code()] [Address constant mutation] If AccountAddress::ONE/THREE/FOUR values change in updates, can old state keys with outdated system address checks grant wrong privileges? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/state_key/mod.rs] [Function: resource()] [Double registration race] If two threads call resource() for same struct_tag+address simultaneously, can both successfully add to registry creating duplicate entries? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/state_key/mod.rs] [Function: table_item()] [Key cloning race] Line 197 in registry.rs clones key to Vec<u8>—can concurrent modifications to input key slice cause data race during clone? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/state_key/mod.rs] [Function: size()] [Size addition overflow] Lines 103-105 add sizes without overflow checks—can sum of components exceed usize::MAX causing wrapped size values? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/state_key/mod.rs] [Function: get_shard_id()] [Nibble extraction overflow] Line 218 extracts nibble(0)—if nibble() has incorrect bounds, can this access out-of-bounds hash data? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/state_key/mod.rs] [Function: resource()] [StructTag complexity attack] No visible limits on StructTag complexity—can an attacker create deeply nested or extremely long StructTags to exhaust memory during serialization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/state_key/mod.rs] [Function: resource_group()] [StructTag injection] Lines 160-170 accept any StructTag for resource groups—can an attacker inject malicious StructTags that break resource group invariants? (High)
